abstract_summ: In general, the hybridization of VMD outperformed single forecasting models regarding the accuracy, specifically when the horizon is six-days-ahead, the hybrid VMD–single models achieved better accuracy in 70% of the cases.We integrate the most updated COVID-19 epidemiological data before June 16, 2020 into the Logistic model to fit the cap of epidemic trend, and then feed the cap value into Fbprophet model, a machine learning based time series prediction model to derive the epidemic curve and predict the trend of the epidemic.Clearly, forecasting the “confirmed” and “recovered” COVID-19 cases helps planning to control the disease and plan for utilization of health care resources.We first performed four different prediction models; Autoregressive Model, Moving Average, a combination of both (ARMA), and integrated ARMA (ARIMA), to determine the best model fit, and we found out that the ARIMA model outperformed the other models.Developing efficient short-term forecasting models allow forecasting the number of future cases.
title_summ: Forecasting the dynamics of COVID-19 Pandemic in Top 15 countries in April 2020: ARIMA Model with Machine Learning ApproachPredicting the epidemic trend of COVID-19 in China and across the world using the machine learning approachForecasting COVID-19 Dynamics and Endpoint in Bangladesh: A Data-driven ApproachThe Hybrid Forecasting Method SVR-ESAR forCovid-19Machine learning model estimating number of COVID-19 infection cases over coming 24 days in every province of South Korea (XGBoost and MultiOutputRegressor)A Novel Heuristic Global Algorithm to Predict the COVID-19 Pandemic TrendCOVID-SGIS: A smart tool for dynamic monitoring and temporal forecasting of Covid-19Covid-19 Pandemic Data Analysis and Forecasting using Machine Learning AlgorithmsForecasting Covid-19 Outbreak Progression in Italian Regions: A model based on neural network training from Chinese dataCOVID-19 Outbreak Prediction with Machine LearningCOVID-19 Pandemic Prediction for Hungary; a Hybrid Machine Learning ApproachArtificial Intelligence Forecasting of Covid-19 in ChinaTime Series Analysis and Forecasting of COVID-19 Cases Using LSTM and ARIMA ModelsA Methodological Approach for Predicting COVID-19 Epidemic Using EEMD-ANN Hybrid ModelTime Series Analysis and Forecast of the COVID-19 Pandemic in India using Genetic ProgrammingShort-term forecasting COVID-19 cumulative confirmed cases: Perspectives for BrazilONLINE FORECASTING OF COVID-19 CASES IN NIGERIA USING LIMITED DATAPrediction of Epidemic Trends in COVID-19 with Logistic Model and Machine Learning TechnicsForecasting the prevalence of COVID-19 outbreak in Egypt using nonlinear autoregressive artificial neural networksForecasting Brazilian and American COVID-19 cases based on artificial intelligence coupled with climatic exogenous variablesStudy of ARIMA and Least Square Support Vector Machine (LS-SVM) Models for the Prediction of SARS-CoV-2 Confirmed Cases in the Most Affected CountriesTime series modelling to forecast the confirmed and recovered cases of COVID-19Forecasting the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic in Saudi Arabia using ARIMA prediction model under current public health interventions.
title_abstract_phrases: In general, the hybridization of VMD outperformed single forecasting models regarding the accuracy, specifically when the horizon is six-days-ahead, the hybrid VMD–single models achieved better accuracy in 70% of the cases.We integrate the most updated COVID-19 epidemiological data before June 16, 2020 into the Logistic model to fit the cap of epidemic trend, and then feed the cap value into Fbprophet model, a machine learning based time series prediction model to derive the epidemic curve and predict the trend of the epidemic.Among the standard models for COVID-19 global pandemic prediction, simple epidemiological and statistical models have received more attention by authorities, and they are popular in the media.We first performed four different prediction models; Autoregressive Model, Moving Average, a combination of both (ARMA), and integrated ARMA (ARIMA), to determine the best model fit, and we found out that the ARIMA model outperformed the other models.All AI techniques are evaluated in the task of time-series forecasting with one, three, and six-days-ahead the cumulative COVID-19 cases in five Brazilian and American states, with a high number of cases up to April 28th, 2020.
